title: Plate Tectonics and Earth's Structure

vocab.definition: The theory that Earth's outer shell is made of moving pieces called plates
The slow movement of continents across Earth's surface over millions of years
Sudden shaking of the ground caused by movement of tectonic plates
An opening in Earth's crust where molten rock can erupt to the surface
The thick layer of hot rock beneath Earth's crust

teachingNotes: Use maps showing plate boundaries and real examples of earthquakes and volcanoes. Discuss evidence for continental drift including fossils and rock formations.

sample.question: What is the theory that explains how continents move over time?

truefalse.question: Earth's outer shell is made of moving pieces called tectonic plates.

fillintheblank.question: The thick layer of hot rock beneath Earth's crust is called the ________.

shortanswer.question: What evidence supports the theory of continental drift?
